channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Weird Al' grapples with the complicated feelings of watching his daughter grow up
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Weird Al" Yankovic grapples with the complicated feelings of watching his daughter grow up.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Weird Al" Yankovic grapples with the complicated feelings of watching his daughter grow up.

item.title: 5 takeaways from the 2026 Oscar nominations, where 'Sinners' made history
item.description: Sinners landed a record number of nods, while Avatar: Fire and Ash and Wicked: For Good fell short of their franchise predecessors.
item.content:encoded: Sinners landed a record number of nods, while Avatar: Fire and Ash and Wicked: For Good fell short of their franchise predecessors.
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: 'The White Hot' asks: If men can go find themselves, why can't women?
item.description: Quiara Alegría Hudes' novel was inspired by Siddhartha and other classic tales of men seeking enlightenment. It's about a mother in Philadelphia who buys a bus ticket, leaving her daughter behind.
item.content:encoded:
Quiara Alegría Hudes' novel was inspired by Siddhartha and other classic tales of men seeking enlightenment. It's about a mother in Philadelphia who buys a bus ticket, leaving her daughter behind.

(Image credit: Emma Pratte)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: 'Even the Dead' wraps up John Banville's smart, moody mystery series
item.description: Originally published under a pseudonym, Banville's Quirke mystery series follows a troubled Dublin coroner who dwells in the basement morgue of a hospital.
item.content:encoded: Originally published under a pseudonym, Banville's Quirke mystery series follows a troubled Dublin coroner who dwells in the basement morgue of a hospital.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan

item.title: See the full list of 2026 Oscar nominations
item.description: Horror movie Sinners has a record 16 nominations this year, including for best picture, actor Michael B. Jordan and a new category: achievement in casting.
item.content:encoded:
Horror movie Sinners has a record 16 nominations this year, including for best picture, actor Michael B. Jordan and a new category: achievement in casting.

(Image credit: Kevin Winter)
item.dc:creator: Clare Lombardo

item.title: 'Sinners' makes history with 16 Oscar nominations
item.description: Nominations for the 98th Academy Awards were announced early Thursday, including a new category debuting this year.
item.content:encoded: Nominations for the 98th Academy Awards were announced early Thursday, including a new category debuting this year.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Netflix reboots 'Star Search' with a twist for the TikTok generation
item.description: Netflix rebooted the talent show Star Search this week, hosted by Anthony Anderson with judges Sarah Michelle Gellar, Jelly Roll and Chrissy Teigen. The original gave early exposure to stars like Beyoncé and Britney Spears.
item.content:encoded: Netflix rebooted the talent show Star Search this week, hosted by Anthony Anderson with judges Sarah Michelle Gellar, Jelly Roll and Chrissy Teigen. The original gave early exposure to stars like Beyoncé and Britney Spears.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Sundance prepares for its final Park City festival before moving to Boulder, Colo.
item.description: As the festival prepares to move to Colorado, filmmakers and cinephiles gather to celebrate its founder and the future of indie film.
item.content:encoded:
As the festival prepares to move to Colorado, filmmakers and cinephiles gather to celebrate its founder and the future of indie film.

(Image credit: Mandalit del Barco)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Public domain contest challenges filmmakers to remix Betty Boop, Nancy Drew and more
item.description: Nearly 280 filmmakers entered the Internet Archive's annual contest celebrating creative freedom without copyright restrictions.
item.content:encoded:
Public Domain Film Remix Contest this year. Above, a still from King of Jazz. The 1930 film was used as source material in several contest submissions.'/>

Nearly 280 filmmakers entered the Internet Archive's annual contest celebrating creative freedom without copyright restrictions.

(Image credit: Universal Pictures/Internet Archive)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: How the word 'cravat' came from the battlefields of 17th century Europe
item.description: In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.
item.content:encoded:
In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.

(Image credit: Hrvoje Polan)
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja
